lines.text: War isn't Hell. War is war, and Hell is Hell. And of the two, war is a lot worse.
How do you figure, Hawkeye?
Easy, Father. Tell me, who goes to Hell?
Sinners, I believe.

Exactly. There are no innocent bystanders in Hell. War is chock full of them - little kids, cripples, old ladies. In fact, except for some of the brass, almost everybody involved is an innocent bystander.
Due To circumstances beyond our control, lunch will be served today.
This is the last straw!
Remind me to order more straws.

[takes a drink of Hawkeye's home-made gin, and grimaces]
I thought this stuff was supposed to make you feel better.
No. It's supposed to make you feel nothing.
Will you stop saying what I'm thinking?
One of us has to.
It's nice to be nice... to the nice.
[about Hawkeye and BJ]
Please excuse these two, they're themselves today.

[to Klinger]
You're a tribute to man's endurance. A monument to hope in size 12 pumps. I hope you do get out someday. There would be a battalion of men in hoop skirts right behind you.
That's not my department, sir - intelligence is something I try to avoid.
My own father didn't have me until he was 63, and the first time we played peek-a-boo together he had a stroke.
The men hate me, don't they?
Just your guts, sir.
[PA Announcement after 3 weeks without wounded]
00 in the morning... And midnight has been canceled.
Do we have enough sherry and ginger-ale for the General?
Oh, nobody does, sir.
Oh, fine then, if nobody does we don't have to, but make sure we do, just in case we don't.
You think you're real smart. But you're not smart; you're dumb. Very dumb. But you've met your match in me.
I know I'm a real asset.
You're only off by two letters.
I'm too frightened to be scared.
Klinger, you are a gentleman and a lady.
Colonel, an ambulance has turned over in the compound, you better come on the double.
Anybody hurt?
Well, the driver's a bit shaken-up, but he'll be all right.
No-one else inside?
No.
Thank God.
I already did.

[on the phone with the US]
Whoa, did you know it's yesterday there?
Well, it's today here.
It's always today here.
Oh, yeah? What about tomorrow?
Good point.
Ha, I wasn't born yesterday!

[to a patient in cardiac arrest]
Live! That's an order!
Life, Liberty, and Pursuit of happy hour.
Spontaneity has its time and its place.
I haven't washed my hands since I became a psychiatrist.
You're always wrong, Frank. That's what's so right about you.
[as Maj. Burns looks for bombs in a field]
What's Frank up to?
I think he's vacuuming Korea. Eisenhower's coming; he wants everything just so.
It's the way these yellow devils think. It's burned into their brains. Kill Americans, kill, kill. They don't respect human life the way we do. I'd like to take him out and shoot him.

[Klinger enters Potter's office with a giant salami in one hand, and a giant loaf of bread in the other]
50 more pounds, and I'm homeward-bound!
You're going to *eat* you way to a discharge?
I call it "Food for Freedom"!
I call it "Suicide by Salami"!
I'll take my chances!
Okay, when you can't get through that door, come see me.
I'll be wearing a size 30, sir.
Insanity is just a state of mind
never have so many suffered so much so so few could be so happy.
We're lucky to be two of the few and not the many.
I know, darling, and I love being both of us.
Act like a man, you sniveling twerp!
Klinger, how dare you wear that hat while in uniform?
It's spring, sir.
[to Margaret]
Did anyone ever tell you, you have the voice of a songbird slowly drowning in tar?
The General answers his own phone. Must be a Unitarian.
If you act drunk long enough, you get a REAL hangover.
Sir, there's someone waiting to see you.
I was born with someone waiting to see me.
Why don't you guys like me?
Because you're a lousy doctor and a rotten person.
Aside from that.
Well, there's your pimples.
My pores won't close.
How much of this can a man take? We must have seen this picture twelve times in the last month. Its a recurring nightmare with popcorn.
Blow in my ear.
What?
I'm so cold I think my pilot's gone out.
[Margaret has just thanked Hawkeye]
Margaret, I'm honored, touched... and aroused.
I could kill you with one finger.
Attention all Allied personnel! There are only about half a dozen stars visible, sky-wise. I am directly under the brightest one.
Very good, Frank.
They'll start looking for us in Bethlehem.
[Calling Maj. Freedman]
Sidney? Hawkeye Pierce. Did I interrupt you in the middle of someone?
Sir, I was just crossing the compound when...
I have no interest in the compound.
He has no compound-interest.

I'm sick of hearing about the wounded. What about all the thousands of wonderful guys who are fighting this war without any of the credit or the glory that always goes to those lucky few who just happen to get shot?
Klinger, get back here as fast as you can. We want a few minutes before the party to beat the daylights out of you.
Hunnicutt, I've known a lot of people in my life. You are not among them.
See these fresh oranges? They don't grow on trees, you know.
[some wounded arrive during the night]
Attention, all personnel - we interrupt your sweet dreams to bring you the following nightmare.
[there has been a long wait for a large load of wounded people]
Attention, all personnel... the wounded you've all been waiting for has finally arrived in person... report to the Big Top immediately; the circus is about to begin.

[in describing the Swamp]
We like it. It's modeled after the Chicago sewer system.
I'm taking this to a higher authority.
Aw, Frank... you're not going to write your mother again.
I wonder if I can say something useful?
I often wonder that too, Frank.

[Some Refugees leave on a truck, Father Mulcahy is handing out the Holy Bible]
Here you go kids... just something to read on the way.
If you have any questions they have branch offices everywhere.

[speaking to Klinger]
Unhand me you varlet, you know not who you touch.
Courage is something you shouldn't be afraid to have.
Oh, Frank. You're so above average.
I love it here.
Either you or Klinger is nuts. Now I have to figure out which one.
[South Koreans are being taught to speak English]
We're making real progress.
I can tell. You have a Korean accent.
I am a woman, after all.

[turning to Burns]
Is that true, Frank?

[after being asked a question]
How should I know? I dropped out of school to become a doctor.
Take a walk, Frank.
Yeah, take a major walk.
Frank, whatever it is, just write it down and put it on my desk where I can't find it.
All right, where's my razor?
Been shaving your legs again, Frank?

[offering to go through the local black market, for needed medicines]
You'd be surprised what a priest can get away with.
Will Scotch be all right for everybody, sir?
Yeah, fine, Radar - perfect.

[offering a drink to Captain Sloan]
Uh, I ran out of ice sir, so I used bourbon.

[handing Frank an unused Hari-Kari knife]
Why don't you do us a favour, and break it in!

[after discovering a patient that is a baby]
Boy, did his draft board go crazy!
You're a better nurse than I am, Gunga Din.

[describing General Mitchell]
Honest, true blue as the day is long, and about as interesting as a five-pound bag of fertilizer.
Sir, I've had a lot of experience in these matters.
I do not need the wisdom of your experience. I am not selling watches from the trunk of a car.
You disgust me!
You're right, Frank... I discussed you with everyone I know and we all find you disgusting.

[Grabs Margaret's arm to keep her from walking away from him]
Margaret, can't we please talk about this?
Remove your hand or I'll zap you with my knee.
[Frank removes his hand]
Big surprise dinner party. Spectacularly unforgetable. Have you ever considered renting your mouth out to the motor pool as a garage?
They got a lot of guts.
And they keep serving them.
[it is extremely hot outside]
Attention, all personnel - incoming wounded. Out of the frying pan and into the O.R.
Hear ye, Hear ye, it's 0700 and all is hell. Incoming wounded, folks.
I don't see why the American taxpayer has to pay for a wedding between these two *pagans*.
They're not pagans, Frank. Everyone's going to be wearing clothes.
I've never met a nurse that didn't register.

[Potter, Hawkeye & BJ are drinking in the Swamp]
Y'know, I had a still, on Guam. One night, it blew up!
[leans forward conspiratorially]
That's how I got my Purple Heart.
Attention all personnel. Due to the shortage of oil and wood, tonight's movie will be burned at 1800.
[some wounded arrive during the night]
Attention, all personnel - this is your wake-up call.

[Looking for Klinger]
Where is that Lebanese mongoose?
